critical:
3717-1-06.4(K) / Controlling pests.Critical    Presence of live insects, rodents, and other pests.
-Observed small flies near the soda dispensers at the upstairs bar.
-PIC reports they use Central Extermination for pest control and Multi-Flow services the lines.

3717-1-03.4(H)(1) / Ready-to-eat, time/temperature controlled for safety food - disposition.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Ready-to-eat, TCS food not properly discarded when required.
-Observed various sauces made in the facility with expired date marks.
-PIC discarded expired sauces.
-Reviewed date marking. Ensure any food item made in the facility, including sauces, are discarded after 7 days.
non_critical:
3717-1-03.4(E) / Cooling methods - temperature and time control.  Corrected During Inspection Improper method for cooling TCS foods.
-Observed several trays of potatoes cooling in the walk in cooler covered with lids and stacked on top of each other.
-PIC removed the lids from the trays of potatoes.
-Discussed different methods for cooling food items.

critical: No critical violations were documented at the time of inspection.
non_critical: No violations were documented at the time of inspection.

critical:
3717-1-04.1(C) / Food-contact surfaces - cleanabilityCritical  Corrected During Inspection Food contact surfaces not easily cleanable.
-Observed a broken plastic storage container on an equipment shelf. 
-PIC voluntarily discarded the plastic storage container.

3717-1-05.1(O)(2) / Using a handwashing sink - other uses prohibited.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Handwashing sink is being used for purposes other than handwashing.
-Observed a large bucket in the handwash sink at the upstairs bar. 
-PIC immediately removed the bucket.  
 3717-1-04.4(N)(1) / Manual and mechanical warewashing equipment, chemical sanitization (chlorine) - temp., pH, concentration, and hardnessCritical Repeat Corrected During Inspection Chlorine sanitizing solution at incorrect temperature and/or concentration.
-Observed the chlorine based sanitizer in the mechanical dishwasher to be less than 10ppm. 
-PIC primed the machine. Observed the sanitizer to be 100ppm after being primed. 
 3717-1-06.4(K) / Controlling pests.Critical    Presence of live insects, rodents, and other pests.
-Observed numerous small flies in the upstairs bar.
-To prevent the haborage of pests, discussed removing soiled wiping cloths and ensuring equipment is properly cleaned at the end of the night.
-Contact a licensed pest control operator.
non_critical:
3717-1-03.2(K) / In-use utensils - between-use storage.    In-use utensils improperly stored.
-Observed metal cups used as ice scoops in the upstairs bar. 
-Obtain and use a scoop with a handle. Ensure the scoop is stored in a manner that prevents the handle from touching the ice. 
 3717-1-06.4(A) / Repairing.    -Observed some vinyl floor tiles in the "soda room" in the basement are detached from the floor leaving the bare concrete exposed.
-Repair the floor.

critical:
3717-1-03.2(A)(2) / Preventing contamination from hands - bare hand contactCritical  Corrected During Inspection Improper bare-hand contact with RTE foods. Observed employee bare hand contact buns for sandwich. Ensure that all ready to eat foods are handled with gloves or utensils only. Discussed with employee- employee voluntarily discarded buns and put on gloves.  
 3717-1-04.4(N)(1) / Manual and mechanical warewashing equipment, chemical sanitization (chlorine) - temp., pH, concentration, and hardnessCritical    Chlorine sanitizing solution at incorrect concentration. Dishwasher not dispensing sanitizer. Properly adjust machine to maintain 50-100 PPM.  
 3717-1-04.4(N)(3) / Manual and mechanical warewashing equipment, chemical sanitization (quaternary ammonium) - temp., pH, concentration, and hardnessCritical  Corrected During Inspection Quaternary ammonium sanitizing solution at incorrect concentration. Observed sanitizer spray bottles below 200 PPM. Bottles remade during inspection. Ensure that sanitizer is 200-400 PPM. 
 3717-1-03.4(H)(1) / Ready-to-eat, time/temperature controlled for safety food - disposition.Critical Repeat   Ready-to-eat, TCS food not properly discarded when required. Observed in-house made sauces/dressings over 7 day limit. Ensure that all foods are used/discarded by the 7 day limit. 
 3717-1-07.1(A) / Poisonous or toxic materials: Storage: separation.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Improper storage of poisonous or toxic materials. Observed sanitizer bottles stored above prep top cooler, next to gloves/ above prep surface in basement. Ensure that chemicals are stored below foods/clean equipment to avoid contamination.
non_critical:
3717-1-04.5(B)(5) / Equipment food-contact surfaces and utensils - cleaning frequency.    Utensils and equipment contacting non-TCS foods not cleaned at required frequency. Observed build up on ice machine panels upstairs and downstairs- ensure that ice machines are drained and properly cleaned before resuming use.
Observed pop gun holders with uncleanable surfaces- ensure pop gun holders are properly cleaned and a smooth, durable, easily cleanable surface.

critical: No critical violations were documented at the time of inspection.
non_critical: No violations were documented at the time of inspection.

critical:
3717-1-03.1 (H) / Temperature - specifications for receivingCritical    Receiving refrigerated foods above 41*F. Discussed with owner and employees. Owner brought foods from food source without temperature control. Discussed time and temperatures of foods that need to be received cold. Ensure that foods are transported with coolers/ice packs/ under refrigeration to maintain foods at proper temperatures. Observed eggs 51*F, tofu 45*F. Items placed in walk in cooler- owner states eggs are not for facility. Recommended discarding eggs.  
 3717-1-03.4(D) / Cooling - temperature and time control.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Improper cooling of TCS food. Observed fries parcooked yesterday with lids on containers in cooler at 43-47*F. Foods shall be cooled from 135-70*F within 2 hours and 70-41*F within another 4 for 6 hours total. Facility voluntarily discarded food. 
 3717-1-03.4(F)(1)(b) / Time/temperature controlled for safety food - cold holding.Critical  Corrected During Inspection TCS foods not being cold held at the proper temperature. Observed foods in middle cooler above 41*F- bean patty 46*F, felafel 44-45*F, eggs above 41*F- items that were above 41*F were without lids. Items with lids were 41*F or below. Facility put lids on foods and temperature lowered for each food by the end of inspection.
Facility maintaining parcooked fries and tater tots on counter without temperature control for use. Any foods left out on counter needs to have a time stamp and needs to be used by the 4 hour limit or discarded. Any foods that are unlabeled shall be discarded. Facility shall submit in writing what foods they will be using time in lieu of temperature control for.  
 3717-1-03.4(G) / Ready-to-eat, time/temperature controlled for safety food - date marking.Critical    Refrigerated, ready-to-eat, TCS foods not properly date marked. Items made in house missing date mark. Ensure all foods are properly date marked for day opened/prepped and dicarded within 7 day limit. 
 3717-1-04.4(I) / Manual warewashing equipment - wash solution temperature.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Manual wash solution not being maintained at 110˚ F or above. Observed wash sinks at 99*F and 104*F.
non_critical:
3717-1-02.3(A) / Food contamination prevention - eating, drinking, or using tobacco.    Employee eating, drinking, or using tobacco in non-designated area. Observed employees eating and drinking in kitchen/ prep areas. Employees shall only eat/ drink in designated areas.  
 3717-1-03.4(E) / Cooling methods - temperature and time control.  Corrected During Inspection Improper method for cooling TCS foods. Observed foods cooling from yesterday in cooler in large containers with lids. Ensure that when cooling foods, containers are small/ flat pans are used if possible and foods are cooled within the time frame without lids. Once food is 41*F, lids can be placed.  
 3717-1-05.3(I) / Other liquid wastes and rainwater.    Improper disposal of condensation and other nonsewage liquids. Observed condensate line and drain line in hand washing sink in basement. Correctly plumb drain lines so that they are not in the hand sink.

critical: No critical violations were documented at the time of inspection.
non_critical: No violations were documented at the time of inspection.

critical:
3717-1-03.1(L) / Package integrity - specifications for receivingCritical    Food package(s) received in poor condition. Observed dented cans in basement area- dented cans shall not be used for facility- returned or discarded.  
 3717-1-03.4(F)(1)(b) / Time/temperature controlled for safety food - cold holding.Critical  Corrected During Inspection TCS foods not being cold held at the proper temperature. Prep cooler across from prep table in kitchen foods ~50-51 degrees F. Checked cooler after about 40 minutes to see if cooler had been on defrost. Cooler ambient temperature ~50 degrees F at end of inspection. Do not use cooler until properly maintaining 41 degrees F or below. All TCS foods voluntarily discarded during inspection. Discussed cooler next to grill- suggested keeping items that are not TCS closest to grill to prevent foods to go out of temperature. Kraut ~45 degrees in cooler next to grill. Kraut moved during inspection.   
 3717-1-03.4(H)(1) / Ready-to-eat, time/temperature controlled for safety food - disposition.Critical    Ready-to-eat, TCS food not properly discarded when required. All TCS food products made in house shall be discarded within 7 day limit. Discussed with owner.

Hot shot bar voluntarily discarded during inspection.

 3717-1-03.4(C) / Thawing - temperature and time control.  Corrected During Inspection TCS foods not properly thawed.
-Observed reduced oxygen packaged raw tuna steaks, thawed in refrigeration, which were not properly vented. Manager voluntarily discarded to prevent foodborne illness.

critical:
3717-1-04.1(C) / Food-contact surfaces - cleanabilityCritical Repeat   Food contact surfaces were not easily cleanable, or not designed/constructed properly. Observed several food grade plastic containers with large cracks that made the equipment not smooth and not easily cleanable. To prevent the growth of pathogens, Multiuse food-contact surfaces shall be: (1) Smooth; (2) Free of breaks, open seams, cracks, chips, inclusions, pits, and similar imperfections; (3) Free of sharp internal angles, corners, and crevices; (4) Finished to have smooth welds and joints; and (5) Except for cooking oil storage tanks, distribution lines for cooking oils, or beverage syrup lines or tubes; accessible for cleaning and inspection by one of the following methods: (a) Without being disassembled; (b) By disassembling without the use of tools; or (c) by easy disassembling with the use of handheld tools commonly available to maintenance and cleaning personnel such as screwdrivers, pliers, open-end wrenches, and Allen wrenches.Inventory all equipment and discard containers and utensils that have cracks.
 3717-1-04.5(A)(1) / Cleanliness of equipment food-contact surfaces and utensils.Critical    Equipment food-contact surfaces or utensils are dirty. Observed the piping holding the multi-flow dispenser to contain build up at the time of inspection.To prevent contamination, equipment food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. Remove clamps from plumbing fixture and wash, rinse, and sanitize as necessary to prevent contamination.
 3717-1-04.5(A)(1) / Cleanliness of equipment food-contact surfaces and utensils.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Equipment food-contact surfaces or utensils are dirty. Observed build-up in the plastic food container holding the ice scoop in the basement food preparation area. To prevent contamination, equipment food-contact surfaces and utensils shall be clean to sight and touch. PIC removed the container and scoop to be washed, rinsed, and sanitized at the time of inspection.
non_critical:
3717-1-04.5(A)(3) / Cleanliness of nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment.    Non-food contact surfaces of equipment are dirty. Observed the bottom and walls of the work-top two door cooler in the basement food preparation area to contain build-up. Observed build-up on the hoods above the fryer in the kitchen.Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept clean. Clean and sanitize the shelves, bottom, and walls of this cooler. Clean and degrease the hoods to prevent the accumulation of dust and grease.
 3717-1-04.8(E) / Equipment, utensils, linens, single-service articles, and single-use articles - storage.    Cleaned equipment and utensils, laundered linens, or single-service and single-use articles are not properly stored. Observed clean equipment and utensils stored directly below a wall-mounted A/C unit with dust build-up in the air filter and on top of the unit.Cleaned equipment and utensils, laundered linens, single-service articles, and single-use articles shall be properly stored as described in this rule. Remove air filters from the A/C and thoroughly clean. Clean the top of the A/C unit. Monitor wall-mounted A/C and clean as necessary to prevent dust contamination below.
 3717-1-05.1(S)(1) / Plumbing system - maintained in good repair.    The plumbing system was not properly repaired. Observed the handwashing sink near the dish machine to be leaking into a five gallon bucket at the time of inspection.A plumbing system shall be repaired according to the Ohio building code. Repair the plumbing connection to the basin and/or the fixture to prevent leaking.

critical:
3717-1-04.1(C) / Food-contact surfaces - cleanabilityCritical  Corrected During Inspection Food contact surfaces were not easily cleanable, or not designed/constructed properly. Observed a cracked plastic ice scoop at the time of inspection that was not smooth and easily cleanable.To prevent the growth of pathogens, Multiuse food-contact surfaces shall be: (1) Smooth; (2) Free of breaks, open seams, cracks, chips, inclusions, pits, and similar imperfections; (3) Free of sharp internal angles, corners, and crevices; (4) Finished to have smooth welds and joints; and (5) Except for cooking oil storage tanks, distribution lines for cooking oils, or beverage syrup lines or tubes; accessible for cleaning and inspection by one of the following methods: (a) Without being disassembled; (b) By disassembling without the use of tools; or (c) by easy disassembling with the use of handheld tools commonly available to maintenance and cleaning personnel such as screwdrivers, pliers, open-end wrenches, and Allen wrenches. PIC discarded the ice scoop at the time of inspection.
 3717-1-07(B) / Poisonous or toxic materials: Working containers - common name.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Observed a spray bottle of water in the food preparation area in the basement. Bottle was not properly labeled, but food employee knew what the bottle contained. Discussed and provided education on labeling working containers of spray bottles (chemical or non-chemical) to avoid misuse by employees (sanitizing surfaces with water, spraying diluted bleach water on food, etc.)To prevent health hazards, working containers used for poisonous or toxic materials such as cleaners and sanitizers taken from bulk supplies shall be clearly and individually identified with the common name of the material. PIC labeled the bottle at the time of inspection.
non_critical:
3717-1-04.4(A)(1) / Equipment - good repair and proper adjustment.    Equipment and/or components are not maintained in good working order. Observed the freezer in the kitchen to be running at higher ambient temperatures than manufacturer recommendations specify. Observed an ambient temperature of the freezer at 12 degrees Fahrenheit. PIC stated the freezer is being replaced with a commercial, NSF approved freezer as verified by the licensor through a Webstaurant online order confirmation and shipment tracking. Shipment was "In Transit" at the time of inspection. Food employees stated food is transferred to freezers in the basement in the evening to prevent thawing and re-freezing. Inspected the basement area to find adequate freezer capacity to keep frozen foods frozen. Did not observe any frozen foods exhibiting signs of thawing at the time of inspection.Equipment shall be maintained in a state of repair and condition that meets the requirements specified under rules 3717-1-04 and 3717-1-04.1 of this code. Repair and or replace the equipment.
 3717-1-04.5(A)(3) / Cleanliness of nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment.    Non-food contact surfaces of equipment are dirty. Observed the shelving units in the walk-in cooler in the basement to be dirty. Observed the fans of the walk-in cooler to be dirty and contain dust build-up at the time of inspection.Nonfood-contact surfaces of equipment shall be kept clean. Clean the shelving units in the walk-in cooler. Clean the fans in the walk-in cooler to prevent contamination of food.

critical: No critical violations were documented at the time of inspection.
non_critical: No violations were documented at the time of inspection.

critical:
3717-1-03.2(C) / Packaged and unpackaged food - preventing contamination by separation, packaging, and segregationCritical    Observed food that was not properly protected from contamination by separation, packaging, and segregation.
-Observed raw eggs stored above potatoes and beer in the walk-in cooler. To prevent contamination, food shall be protected from cross contamination by separating raw animal foods during storage, preparation, holding, and display from cooked ready-to-eat food as described in this rule.
-Rearrange food so that raw is stored below or away from ready-to-eat product. Correct By: 06-Dec-2016
 3717-1-03.4(F)(1) / Time/temperature controlled for safety food - hot and cold holding.Critical    TCS foods were not being held at the proper temperature.
-Observed food in the prep cooler holding between 42°F and 50°F. To prevent the growth of pathogens, except during preparation, cooking, or cooling, or when time is used as a public health control, TCS food shall be held at 135°F or above, or at 41°F or less.
-During inspection, food that was above 41°F for longer than 4 hours was voluntarily discarded. Repair refrigeration as necessary to maintain food at 41°F or less. Correct By: 06-Dec-2016
non_critical:
3717-1-03.2(Q) / Food storage - preventing contamination from the premises.    Observed improper storage of food items.
-Observed boxes of food product stored directly on the floor in the walk-in cooler, dry storage, and outside walk-in freezer. Food shall be protected from contamination by storing the food in a clean, dry location, where it is not exposed to splash, dust, or other contamination, and at least six inches above the floor.
-Store food off the floor to prevent possible contamination. Provide additional shelving if necessary to store food off the floor. Correct By: 06-Dec-2016
 3717-1-04.1(Y) / Temperature measuring devices.    Cold or hot holding equipment did not contain a thermometer, or the thermometer was not correctly placed.
-Observed refrigerators without thermometers inside. A properly designed temperature measuring device as specified in this rule shall be located in the warmest part of a cooling unit or the coolest part of a food warming unit.
-Provide thermometers to monitor internal temperatures of refrigerators.
 3717-1-04.8(A) / Equipment and utensils - air-drying required.    Equipment and utensils are not being air dried.
-Observed wet containers stacked in the basement. 
-Observed wet glasses stacked in the upstairs bar. After cleaning and sanitizing, equipment and utensils shall be air-dried or used after adequate draining before contact with food and utensils, and may not be cloth dried.
-Air dry equipment and utensils prior to putting away. Discontinue stacking or putting away wet equipment or utensils. Correct By: 06-Dec-2016
 3717-1-06.4(B) / Cleaning - frequency and restrictions.    Observed a build-up of dirt and debris.
-Observed buildup on fan guards in the walk-in coolers. The physical facilities shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean, and cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of food is exposed.
-Clean fans guards in the walk-in coolers to remove buildup.

critical:
3717-1-03.4(D) / Cooling - temperature and time control.Critical    TCS foods were not cooled using the proper time and temperature parameters.
-Observed chicken in a deep container holding at 48°F in the reach-in cooler; food was prepared Saturday.
-Observed hummus in a deep container holding at 47°F in the reach-in cooler; food was prepared Saturday. 
-Observed chicken breast at 45°F and chicken wings at 46°F in deep containers in the walk-in cooler in the basement; food was prepared earlier in the day. To prevent the growth of pathogens, cooked TCS food shall be rapidly cooled: within two hours from 135°F to 70°F, and within a total of six hours from 135°F to 41°F or less.
-During inspection, food items prepared Saturday were voluntarily discarded. Food items made earlier in the day prior to inspection were spread out on sheet trays to facilitate rapid cooling. 
-Discussed cooling times and temperature control.
 3717-1-06.4(K) / Controlling pests.Critical    Observed the presence of live insects.
-Observed small flies in the beverage nozzles and nozzle holders in the upstairs bar.
-Observed small flies in the main floor bar area. To prevent illness, the presence of insects, rodents, and other pests shall be controlled by: Routinely inspecting incoming shipments of food and supplies; routinely inspecting the premises for evidence of pests; Using methods, if pests are found, such as trapping devices or pesticides used according section (C), (K) and (L) of rule 3717-1-07.1 of this code; and eliminating harborage conditions.
-Contact a licensed pest controller for service.
-Clean where necessary to remove buildup and any harborage conditions.
non_critical:
3717-1-03.2(K) / In-use utensils - between-use storage. Repeat   In-use utensils are improperly stored.
-Observed drink shakers stored in the ice bins in the upstairs bar area.
-Observed ice scoops stored in the hand sink in the upstairs bar area. During pauses in food preparation or dispensing, food preparation and dispensing utensils shall be stored as described in this rule.
-Discontinue storing shakers directly in ice intended for consumption.
-Discontinue storing ice scoops in the hand sink. 
-Wash, rinse, sanitize, and air dry items, then store in a clean location.
 3717-1-04.4(B) / Cutting surfaces.    The surfaces of cutting blocks or boards were severely scratched or scored and could not be effectively cleaned and sanitized.Surfaces such as cutting blocks and boards that are subject to scratching and scoring shall be resurfaced if they can no longer be effectively cleaned and sanitized, or discarded if they are not capable of being resurfaced.

critical:
3717-1-03.4(F)(1) / Time/temperature controlled for safety food - hot and cold holding.Critical    TCS foods were not being held at the proper temperature.
-Observed food in the burger cooler holding above 41F. To prevent the growth of pathogens, except during preparation, cooking, or cooling, or when time is used as a public health control, TCS food shall be held at 135°F or above, or at 41°F or less.
-During inspection, food that was in the cooler less than 4 hours was moved to a different refrigerator. Cook stated a service call would be made.
non_critical:
3717-1-04.1(A) / Equipment and utensils - durability and strength.    Non-durable equipment observed.
-Observed non-food funnels in use; one funnel was cracked. Equipment and utensils shall be designed and constructed to be durable and to retain their characteristic qualities under normal use conditions.
-Provide food-grade funnels for use with food. Cracked funnel was discarded during inspection.
 3717-1-04.4(S)(1) / Single-service articles and single-use articles - use limitation.    Observed re-use of single-service or single-use articles.
-Observed plastic dressing containers re-used to hold dressings mixed in-house. Single-service and single-use articles may not be reused.
-Discontinue re-using dressing containers. Provide addtional containers that are designed to be cleaned and sanitized.

critical:
3717-1-03.2(C) / Packaged and unpackaged food - preventing contamination by separation, packaging, and segregationCritical Repeat   Observed food that was not properly protected from contamination by separation, packaging, and segregation.
-Observed raw food items, such as burgers, chicken, and eggs, stored above vegetables and other ready-to-eat food items in the walk-in cooler. To prevent contamination, food shall be protected from cross contamination by separating raw animal foods during storage, preparation, holding, and display from cooked ready-to-eat food as described in this rule.
-Rearrange food so that raw food is not above ready to eat food or beverages, even if the food is packaged. 
-Discussed using the "brunch shelf" for raw items and the shelves on the sides of the walk-in cooler for ready-to-eat items or items that will not get cooked.    Correct By:  17-Jun-2015
 3717-1-03.4(F)(1) / Time/temperature controlled for safety food - hot and cold holding.Critical  Corrected During Inspection TCS foods were not being held at the proper temperature.
-Observed pans of cooked chicken at 46F in the reach-in cooler; all other items in the cooler were below 41F. Date marks indicated chicken was cooked Friday and Saturday. To prevent the growth of pathogens, except during preparation, cooking, or cooling, or when time is used as a public health control, TCS food shall be held at 135°F or above, or at 41°F or less.
-Corrected; food was voluntarily discarded. Discussed cooling and date marking methods, as well as time and temperature control.
non_critical:
3717-1-03.2(K) / In-use utensils - between-use storage.  Corrected During Inspection In-use utensils are improperly stored.
-Observed stainless steel mixing shakers stored in the ice bins in the upstairs bar. Shakers did not have handles. During pauses in food preparation or dispensing, food preparation and dispensing utensils shall be stored as described in this rule.
-Use utensils with handles for scooping ice from the bin. 
-If utensils will be stored in the ice, the handle must not contact the ice. 
-Discontinue leaving shakers in the ice bins.

critical: 3717-1-03.2(C) / Packaged and unpackaged food - preventing contamination by separation, packaging, and segregationCritical  Corrected During Inspection Observed food that was not properly protected from contamination by separation, packaging, and segregation. A container of raw chicken was stored on top of a container of sliced tomatoes.To prevent contamination, food shall be protected from cross contamination by separating raw animal foods during storage, preparation, holding, and display from cooked ready-to-eat food as described in this rule.
non_critical:
3717-1-03.2(Q) / Food storage - preventing contamination from the premises.    Observed improper storage of food items. Outside building walk-in freezer has boxes of food items stored directly on the floor.  Provide dunnage racks to keep the boxes at least 6 inches above the floor.Food shall be protected from contamination by storing the food in a clean, dry location, where it is not exposed to splash, dust, or other contamination, and at least six inches above the floor.
 3717-1-05.4(H) / Toilet room receptacle - covered. Repeat   Observed no covered receptacle in basement women's restroom.A toilet room used by females shall be provided with a covered receptacle for sanitary napkins.
 3717-1-06.1(I) / Light bulbs - protective shielding. Repeat   Observed light bulbs or heat lamp that were not properly shielded or coated where required. End caps missing on fluorescent lights above the basement food preparation table.Light bulbs shall be shielded, coated, or otherwise shatter-resistant in areas where there is exposed food, clean equipment, utensils, or linens, or unwrapped single-service or single-use articles and does not apply in areas used only for storing food in unopened packages. An infrared or other heat lamp shall be protected against breakage by a shield surrounding and extending beyond the bulb so that only the face of the bulb is exposed.
 3717-1-06.4(A) / Repairing. Repeat   The physical facilities are not being maintained in good repair. Replace missing basement ceiling tiles with ones that are faced with a vinyl, washable surface (located in the dishwashing area).The physical facilities shall be maintained in good repair.

critical:
3717-1-03.4(E) / Cooling methods - temperature and time control.Critical  Corrected During Inspection Observed improper method for cooling TCS foods. Pre-portioned sliced turkey was placed in a deep covered pan while the turkey had an internal food temperature of 48F. Spread the turkey bundles out on a tray until 41F. or less is reached. Then store in a deep container if desired.Cooling shall be accomplished in accordance with the time and temperature criteria by using one or more of the methods based on the type of food being cooled as required in this rule.
 3717-1-03.4(F)(1) / Time/temperature controlled for safety food - hot and cold holding.Critical  Corrected During Inspection TCS foods were not being held at the proper temperature. Chicken breasts @ 67F., chicken wings @ 43F., pre-portioned sliced turkey @ 52F., hummus @ 49F.. All food held on the top rail of the refrigerated make-up unit. Food was discarded and will be covered to keep the kitchen heat from reaching the food.Except during preparation, cooking, or cooling, or when time is used as a public health control, TCS food shall be held at 135°F or above (except for those roasts that are cooked as required may be held at 130° F), or at 41°F or less.
 3717-1-05.3(C) / Backflow prevention.Critical    Observed a direct connection between the sewage system and a drain originating from equipment in which food, portable equipment, or utensils are placed. Food preparation sink in the basement does not have an air gap in the drain.  The plumbing inspector approved a check valve in the drain as adequate protection.A direct connection may not exist between the sewage system and a drain originating from equipment in which food, portable equipment, or utensils are placed unless allowed by the Ohio building code.
non_critical:
3717-1-03.2(D) / Food storage containers - identified with common name of food.    Food storage containers are not properly labeled. Large container of tan liquid stored in the basement kitchen was not identified with the name of the food.Working containers holding food or food ingredients that are removed from their original packages shall be identified with the common name of the food, except containers holding food that are readily and unmistakably recognized.   Correct By:  28-Aug-2014
 3717-1-05.4(H) / Toilet room receptacle - covered.    Observed no covered receptacle in women's restroom. Basement restroom used by women require a covered waste container. Correct as soon as possible.A toilet room used by females shall be provided with a covered receptacle for sanitary napkins.
 3717-1-06.1(I) / Light bulbs - protective shielding.    Observed light bulbs or heat lamp that were not properly shielded or coated where required. Install end caps on each end of the fluorescent lights located in basement kitchen, above the Blakeslee mixer. Correct as soon as possible.Light bulbs shall be shielded, coated, or otherwise shatter-resistant in areas where there is exposed food, clean equipment, utensils, or linens, or unwrapped single-service or single-use articles and does not apply in areas used only for storing food in unopened packages. An infrared or other heat lamp shall be protected against breakage by a shield surrounding and extending beyond the bulb so that only the face of the bulb is exposed.
 3717-1-06.4(A) / Repairing.    The physical facilities are not being maintained in good repair. Replace ceiling tiles in the basement kitchen with tiles that have washable surfaces.The physical facilities shall be maintained in good repair.
